column4: got a ps2/n64 to usb converter... and it's bein a finicky sort. got it to respond in jstest ONCE and recognized in PCSX2 once... now it's poofed again, tho js1 is still there.... any ideas?
it might appear as /dev/input/jsx
or /dev/jsx
it's definitely showin up as /dev/input/js1 currently, but I have seen it on js0 also
i've never tried that converter.  however, a lot of progs look for /dev/jsx by default
you can do a 'sudo lsusb' to see if the device is detected
jstest tho allows you to specify the device... currently it shows *all* the buttons/axis of the joypad, but pushing buttons does not get a response
it shows up in hardware profiles of XFCE
hmmm...
and lsusb (Bus 003 Device 006: ID 6666:0667 Prototype product Vendor ID Smart Joy PSX, PS-PC Smart JoyPad)
so it is there just not functioning...
yup... it worked once... not sure why it stopped. unplug/replug and dmesg picks it up, but no workie.
dunno then
is the joydev module loaded?
it appears to be loaded into the kernel as I cannot modprobe -r it
ok...
scratch that... it just let me remove it
i think it is a module by default
re modprobe'd joydev and unplugged and plugged the usb back in... no change... cept its back on js0. heh
and by pointing a prog at /dev/input/js0 you get no response?
that's correct. even if I cat it
i don't know then
